title: Clinic Overview & Location
text: HealthCare Plus Clinic is located at 245 Green Street, Suite 300, Boston, MA in the Green Medical Plaza on the third floor. Main entrance faces Green Street; the patient drop-off lane is at the west side.

title: Parking Information
text: Parking is free for the first two hours in the attached covered garage (enter on Willow Ave). Additional hours are billed at $3/hour. Accessible parking and elevator access are available from the garage.

title: Public Transportation
text: Public transit options: Green Line to Central Station (0.4 miles) and bus routes 15 and 42 stop at Green & 3rd. Use Central Station exit B and walk 5 minutes north.

title: Clinic Hours
text: We are open Monday–Friday 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM and Saturday 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM. Closed Sundays and federal holidays. Urgent care hours differ—call the clinic for same-day availability.

title: Accepted Insurance Providers
text: We accept Aetna, Cigna, UnitedHealthcare, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Humana, and Medicare. If your plan requires a referral, please bring the referral form to your appointment.

title: Payment Methods
text: We accept credit/debit cards, Apple Pay, Google Pay, HSA/FSA cards, and cash. Online payments are available through our patient portal. Payment plans are offered for qualifying balances.

title: Billing & Copays
text: Copays are collected at check-in. Outstanding balances can be paid online or by calling billing. Insurance claim submission is handled by our billing department.

title: Cancellation Policy
text: Please cancel or reschedule at least 24 hours in advance. Late cancellations or no-shows may incur a $35 fee. Exceptions for emergencies may apply—call the clinic to discuss.

title: Late Arrival Policy
text: If you arrive more than 15 minutes late, we may need to reschedule to avoid delaying other patients. Please call ahead if you expect to be late.

title: COVID-19 Guidelines
text: Masks are optional for most patients; required for symptomatic patients. If you test positive for COVID-19, please reschedule non-urgent visits. Telehealth is available for appropriate appointments.

title: First Visit Documents
text: For your first visit bring government ID, insurance card, medication list, and any referral or prior records. Pediatric visits: bring immunization records and birth certificate if required.

title: What to Expect at a General Consultation
text: A general consultation typically lasts 30 minutes and includes history, exam, and a treatment plan. Bring a list of medications and current symptoms.

title: Follow-up Visit Details
text: Follow-up visits are usually 15 minutes and focus on reviewing progress and medication adjustments. Bring recent lab results if applicable.

title: Physical Exam Requirements
text: Full physical exams take about 45 minutes. Wear comfortable clothes; fasting may be required for some labs—your appointment confirmation will state if fasting is needed.

title: Specialist Consultation
text: Specialist consultations (cardiology, orthopedics, etc.) are typically 60 minutes. Bring prior imaging, lab results, and referral documents if you have them.

title: Walk-In Policy
text: Walk-ins for minor illnesses are accepted 8:00 AM–10:00 AM Monday–Friday, subject to provider availability. For guaranteed times please schedule an appointment.

title: Telehealth Appointments
text: Telehealth visits are available for consults and follow-ups. Not available for procedures or full physical exams. You will receive a secure link via email prior to the appointment.

title: Prescription Refills
text: Refill requests can be submitted via the patient portal or by calling our prescription line. Some medications require an in-person visit before refill.

title: Urgent vs Routine Care
text: If symptoms are severe (chest pain, shortness of breath, severe bleeding) call 911. For urgent but non-life-threatening issues, call the clinic for same-day options.

title: Lab Tests & Results
text: Routine lab tests are processed within 48–72 hours. You can view results in the patient portal or receive them via the contact method you chose at check-in.

title: Immunizations & Vaccines
text: We provide routine adult and pediatric vaccines. Bring a vaccine record for pediatric visits. Some vaccines may require a separate billing authorization.

title: Pre-Procedure Instructions
text: If you have a procedure scheduled, follow fasting or medication instructions provided in your appointment confirmation. Bring an adult escort if sedation is required.

title: Interpreter Services
text: Interpreter services are available upon request. Please request language support at least 48 hours before your appointment.

title: Accessibility Services
text: Wheelchair access and ADA-compliant restrooms are available. If you need additional accommodations, notify us when booking.

title: Privacy & HIPAA
text: We follow HIPAA rules to protect your health information. For questions about privacy practices, view our Notice of Privacy Practices on the website.

title: How to Prepare for a Pediatric Visit
text: Bring immunization records, a list of medications, and any growth concerns. For newborn visits bring birth records and feeding history.

title: Insurance Verification Process
text: Insurance is verified at check-in. If prior authorization is required for specialist services, we will notify you and help obtain necessary approvals.

title: Referrals to Specialists
text: We provide referrals when clinically indicated. Some specialist visits may require a prior authorization from your insurance.

title: Appointment Confirmation & Reminders
text: After booking you receive an email confirmation. We send automated reminders via email & SMS 48 and 24 hours before the appointment.

title: How to Reschedule an Appointment
text: Reschedule via the patient portal, by phone, or ask the agent to reschedule. Try to reschedule at least 24 hours before to avoid late fees.

title: No-Show Policy
text: No-shows may be charged a fee. Excessive no-shows could affect future scheduling privileges. Contact billing for hardship considerations.

title: Security of Online Portal
text: Our patient portal uses industry-standard encryption. Do not share your portal password; contact support to reset if you lose access.

title: How to Add a Family Member
text: Create a family account in the portal or call the clinic to link dependents. Parental consent is required for pediatric care management.

title: Children & Vaccination Appointments
text: Bring immunization booklet and child’s ID. Discuss vaccine hesitancy or scheduling multiple vaccines with the clinician.

title: Travel-Related Health Services
text: Travel consultations and necessary vaccines are available. Schedule at least 4–6 weeks before travel for vaccine series to complete.

title: Smoking Cessation Support
text: We offer counseling and pharmacotherapy options to help quit smoking. Ask during booking to schedule longer counseling sessions.

title: Weight Management Programs
text: We provide nutrition counseling and weight management referrals. Ask to book an initial assessment for personalized plans.

title: Mental Health Referrals
text: We can provide referrals to behavioral health specialists. Urgent psychiatric concerns should be directed to emergency services.

title: Billing Disputes & Questions
text: Contact billing at billing@healthcareplus.example or call the number on your statement to discuss disputes or payment arrangements.

title: Medical Records Requests
text: Request medical records through the patient portal or by submitting a signed authorization form. Processing typically takes up to 30 days.

title: Provider Credentials
text: All providers are board-certified in their specialties. Provider bios and credentials are available on our website under 'Our Team'.

title: Patient Feedback & Complaints
text: Submit feedback via the portal or email feedback@healthcareplus.example. We review complaints promptly and respond within 5 business days.

title: How to Contact the Clinic
text: Main clinic phone: (555) 123-4567. For billing call (555) 123-4568. Office hours listed on website. Use portal for non-urgent messaging.

title: Emergency Policy
text: For life-threatening emergencies call 911. The clinic does not provide emergency room services. For urgent same-day care call the clinic during business hours.

title: After-Hours Care
text: For urgent issues after hours, our answering service will connect you to an on-call provider. Use 911 for emergencies.

title: COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
text: We offer COVID-19 vaccines by appointment. Bring proof of prior doses if requesting boosters; check eligibility on the CDC website.

title: Telehealth Technical Requirements
text: Telehealth requires a device with a camera, microphone, and a modern browser. Test your connection 10 minutes before the appointment.

title: Common Visit Preparations
text: Bring medication list, insurance card, and a list of symptoms. For bloodwork, check fasting requirements on your appointment confirmation.
